item.title: Indonesia's Cryptocurrency Annual Tax Revenue Reaches $364 Million, User Base Exceeds 20 Million
item.description: August 1st. According to the Tax Office of Indonesia, since this year, the annual cryptocurrency tax revenue in Indonesia ranges from 500 billion to 600 billion Indonesian Rupiah (approximately 31.25 million to 36.40 million US dollars). Specifically, the tax revenue in the first year of 2022 was 24.6 billion Rupiah, decreased to 22 billion Rupiah in 2023, surged to 62 billion Rupiah in 2024, and as of now in 2025, 11.5 billion Rupiah has been collected.The Indonesian government has recently updated its cryptocurrency regulatory policy. The tax rate for overseas platforms has been increased to 1%, and the tax rate for domestic platforms has been adjusted to 0.21%. In addition, the value-added tax for buyers has been canceled, and cryptocurrencies have been reclassified as financial assets and are under the supervision of the Financial Services Authority.Currently, there are more than 20 million cryptocurrency users in Indonesia, surpassing the number of local stock market investors

item.title: glassnode: The current downturn experienced a relatively low liquidation volume, indicating that it was primarily driven by the spot market.
item.description: On August 1st, based on the data from the analysis platform glassnode, although Bitcoin dropped by 3.2% and Ethereum by 6%, the market liquidation scale remained at a low level, amounting to only $110 million and $132 million respectively. The slight withdrawal of open interest suggests that this round of correction is mainly driven by the spot market rather than the derivatives market.

item.title: Websea burned 2.16 million WBS in August, with a total of over 63.7 million WBS burned to date.
item.description: On August 1st, the Websea platform accomplished the 34th round of platform token WBS burning. The data indicates that a total of 2,165,156.28 WBS were burned this time, which is an increase of 80,190.97 WBS compared to last month, setting a new record for the buyback burning mechanism. As of the time of writing, the price of WBS is $1.18, and the value of this burning exceeds $2.55 million.After this burning, the total accumulated amount of WBS burned has reached 63,714,740.08, completing 31.86% of the planned 200 million WBS burning. It is reported that the platform will continue to use 10% of the monthly fee revenue for buyback burning until the total supply of WBS is reduced to 100 million.

item.title: Binance Alpha has launched Toshi (TOSHI), with an airdrop claiming threshold of 200 points.
item.description: On August 1st, according to official channels, Binance Alpha has now listed Toshi (TOSHI).Users who hold at least 200 Alpha points are eligible to claim an airdrop of 69,349 TOSHI tokens. The first come, first served principle applies. If the event is not yet completed, the points threshold will automatically decrease by 15 points every hour.

item.title: The9 Limited, the mainland Chinese operator of World of Warcraft, has launched the Web3 game platform the9bit through its Hong Kong subsidiary.
item.description: On August 1st, the Nasdaq-listed company The9 Limited announced that its wholly-owned Hong Kong subsidiary, Vast Ocean International Limited, has launched the Web3 gaming platform the9bit. The9bit has formed a strategic partnership with the blockchain gaming guild Yield Guild Games (YGG). It is reported that the9bit will be integrated into YGG's official onboarding channel and blockchain gaming guild activities.It is reported that from 2005 to 2009, The9 Limited was the exclusive operator of World of Warcraft in mainland China.

item.title: Ethereum Sees Ongoing Negative Premium on Coinbase, First Time Since April
item.description: On August 1st, according to the crypto data platform Kiyotaka, there has been a persistent discount of Ethereum on Coinbase. This marks the first time since April of this year. During this period, Ethereum has surged by more than 150%.

item.title: Publicly traded company Cemtrex purchases $1 million worth of SOL, planning to establish a $10 million cryptocurrency reserve.
item.description: On August 1st, the Nasdaq-listed company Cemtrex (stock code: CETX) announced that it had acquired $1 million worth of SOL as the initial step in its digital asset reserve strategy. The company purchased 5500 SOL at an average price of $181 per coin and intends to gradually expand the size of its cryptocurrency reserves to $10 million.

item.title: JPMorgan: Lowers Coinbase Price Target from $405 to $375
item.description: On August 1st, the financial institution Jefferies issued a report indicating that it had reduced Coinbase's target price from $405 to $375. (Securities Times)

item.title: 华兴资本: Applying to Expand Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission Type 1, 4, and 9 Licenses to Include Digital Asset Business
item.description: On August 1st, as per AASTOCKS, Zi Yuan Shi, the Head of Proprietary Investment at Huaxing Capital, stated that "The company will continuously and actively embrace Web3.0 and the digital asset industry. By leveraging its professional capabilities and high-quality resources through investment banking services, strategic funds, and direct investments, etc., it aims to empower the Hong Kong digital industry ecosystem. The company has applied to expand its Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission Type 1, 4, 9 licenses to cover digital asset business. And it looks forward to collaborating with industry partners to enhance investment and construction efforts in digital asset financial infrastructure, on-chain ecosystems, and RWA assets, jointly promoting industry innovation, stable development, and assisting Hong Kong in becoming a global digital asset hub."

item.title: U.S. Non-Farm Payrolls Data will be released tonight, and the results will have a significant impact on the Fed's September interest rate decision.
item.description: On August 1st, the July employment report, which is scheduled to be released at 8:30 p.m. Beijing time on Friday, is anticipated to indicate an addition of 110,000 jobs, a notable decline from June's 147,000. The unemployment rate is expected to increase from 4.1% to 4.2%, and the average hourly earnings are predicted to rise by 0.3%, which is higher than June's 0.2%. If the forecast proves accurate, it will strengthen the perception of a decelerating job market, although it may not necessarily call for a response from the Fed.Earlier this week during the interest rate meeting, Powell did not offer guidance on the September rate decision, suggesting that there is a significant amount of data to be disclosed before then. Friday's July nonfarm payroll report will be a part of the puzzle that will assist in shaping expectations for a September Fed rate cut.Analysts note that if the nonfarm payroll data is below 100,000 and the unemployment rate rises, it may imply a weakening job mark
